introduction.title: Backend Course
introduction.text: A 4 month accelerated learning program, with focus on Backend using the language Java. It consists of 6 projects, both individual and grupal with set requirements and increasing complexity. The students follow a self study path using curated content from sources like LinkedIn Learning and Pluralsight in addition to live lectures at critical points of the programa. Software engineering practices are taken into consideration, so students can produce code with high value.

process.name: Requirement gathering
process.description: The students start with a brief similar to a real interview coding test. They analyze it by extracting and classifying the information.

process.name: Project spreadsheet
process.description: Allows to organize the information in tables. Like isolating the requirements in one page and building a SCRUM Product Backlog in another.

process.name: UML diagrams
process.description: This diagram helps the students visualize the architecture of the app, it creates a model similar to how a tourist uses a map to familiarize with a new city.

process.name: Coding stage
process.description: Here is when they start the coding process. By now they have a clear understanding of what solution to build.

process.name: Deploy state
process.description: At the final stages of the couse, students follow CI/CD principles to deploy on the cloud by contenerizing their application and automating tests.

projects.name: Recipe manager
projects.description: A project that looks easy on the surface, but after reading the requirements, students must learn project management techniques to prioritize which features to ship.

projects.name: Bank ATM
projects.description: As the course end goal is to work on backends, this project teaches early on the importance of encription to safeguard data.

projects.name: Warehouse system
projects.description: A bigger project that introduces threads to allow multiple employes access the inventory. It also introduces codign design pattersn to keep the complexity in check.

projects.name: Shopping list
projects.description: A basic project so students learn about Sprinboot, Hibernate, and mySQL in a safe envirment.

projects.name: Netflix
projects.description: Combines the learnings of the previous projects and adds cloud deployment and a authentification system.

projects.name: Auction site
projects.description: The final project is a group project that introduces CI/CD concepts.

technologies.name: SpringBoot
technologies.description: The most utilized Backend framework in the Swedish market for building servers.

technologies.name: Hibernate
technologies.description: An Object Relational Mapper (ORM) so students can work on any database by having an abstraction layer.

technologies.name: mySQL
technologies.description: A very popular open source relational database so students learn queries and work with persitant data.

technologies.name: Docker
technologies.description: Docker allow our students to encapsulate their development enviroment to share with others and deply anywhere.

technologies.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
technologies.description: The most popular cloud provider, students learn to deploy their backend projects on a EC2 compute cloud.
